Messages.Value: Thank you for calling the travel agency, this is Sebastian Harris, how may I assist you?
Yes, my name is Michael Martinez and I have a complaint.
I'm sorry to hear that, can you please provide me with more details?

Yes, I recently flew with American Airlines from New York to Los Angeles and there was bad weather which caused a delay of over 3 hours. This caused me to miss my connecting flight and I had to stay overnight in a hotel. I feel that I deserve compensation for this inconvenience.
I understand how frustrating that must have been. Let me pull up your reservation and see what I can do to help.
Thank you, my reservation number is 1234567 and the flight was on August 15th at 8:00 am.

I see that your flight was unfortunately delayed due to bad weather. According to American Airlines' policy, they do not offer compensation for weather-related delays. However, I can assist you in filing a complaint with the airlines in hopes of some kind of resolution.
That's not good enough! I demand compensation for my inconvenience. I will not let this go!

I completely understand your frustration, but unfortunately, there is only so much I can do as a travel agent. I am offering to help you file a complaint with the airline. Would you like me to proceed with that?
Fine, but this is not the end of this. I will be contacting the airline directly as well.
I completely understand and I am here to help in any way I can. Is there anything else I can assist you with today?
Thank you for contacting the travel agency. Have a great day!

Conversation.Full_conversation:
Agent: Thank you for calling the travel agency, this is Sebastian Harris, how may I assist you?
Customer: Yes, my name is Michael Martinez and I have a complaint.
Agent: I'm sorry to hear that, can you please provide me with more details?
Customer: Yes, I recently flew with American Airlines from New York to Los Angeles and there was bad weather which caused a delay of over 3 hours. This caused me to miss my connecting flight and I had to stay overnight in a hotel. I feel that I deserve compensation for this inconvenience.
Agent: I understand how frustrating that must have been. Let me pull up your reservation and see what I can do to help.
Customer: Thank you, my reservation number is 1234567 and the flight was on August 15th at 8:00 am.
Agent: I see that your flight was unfortunately delayed due to bad weather. According to American Airlines' policy, they do not offer compensation for weather-related delays. However, I can assist you in filing a complaint with the airlines in hopes of some kind of resolution.
Customer: That's not good enough! I demand compensation for my inconvenience. I will not let this go!
Agent: I completely understand your frustration, but unfortunately, there is only so much I can do as a travel agent. I am offering to help you file a complaint with the airline. Would you like me to proceed with that?
Customer: Fine, but this is not the end of this. I will be contacting the airline directly as well.
Agent: I completely understand and I am here to help in any way I can. Is there anything else I can assist you with today?
Customer: No, that will be all.
Agent: Thank you for contacting the travel agency. Have a great day!
